 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִמַּר‎</span>] **noun masculine** ==lamb== (Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***immeru***</u></abbr> (also = ***child***; <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***immertu***</u></abbr>, ***girl***; conjectures as to etymology [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>Prol. 28</sup> [[BDB#Jen|Jen]]<sup>ZMG xiiii (1889), 203</sup>; ZA vii. 216 [[BDB#Schw|Schw]]<sup>Idioticon 114</sup>), [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אמריא‎</span>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Punic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אמר‎</span>, Palmyrene plural emphatic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אמריא‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>220</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>Inscr. 120. 337</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (loan-word ? compare [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>107</sup>, but also [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>VOJ i. 24</sup>)); — plural <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִמְּרִין‎</span>, ***lambs***, as sacrificial victims [[Ezra.6.9|Ezra 6:9]]; [[Ezra.6.17|Ezra 6:17]]; [[Ezra.7.17|Ezra 7:17]]. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִנְבֵהּ‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵב‎</span>.
